en: CHAPTER I, THERE IS NO ONE LEFT
zh: 第一章，已经没有人了

en: When Mary Lennox was sent to Misselthwaite Manor to live with her uncle
zh: 当玛丽・伦诺克斯被送到 Misselthwaite Manor 和她叔叔住在一起时

en: everybody said she was the most disagreeable-looking child ever seen.
zh: 大家都说她是有史以来最难相处的孩子。

en: It was true, too.
zh: 这也是真的。

en: She had a little thin face and a little thin body, thin light hair and a sour expression.
zh: 她有一张瘦小的脸，一个瘦小的身体，稀疏的浅色头发和一个酸溜溜的表情。

en: Her hair was yellow, and her face was yellow because she had been born in India and had always been ill in one way or another.
zh: 她的头发是黄色的，她的脸是黄色的，因为她出生在印度，而且总是以这样或那样的方式生病。

en: Her father had held a position under the English Government and had always been busy and ill himself,
zh: 她的父亲在英国政府任职，一直很忙，身体也不好,

en: and her mother had been a great beauty who cared only to go to parties and amuse herself with gay people.
zh: 她的母亲是个大美，她只关心参加聚会，和同性恋者一起消遣。

en: She had not wanted a little girl at all, and when Mary was born she handed her over to the care of an Ayah,
zh: 她根本不想要一个小女孩，玛丽出生的时候，她把她交给一个阿雅照顾,

en: who was made to understand that if she wished to please the Mem Sahib she must keep the child out of sight as much as possible.
zh: 她明白，如果她想取悦 Mem Sahib，就必须尽可能地把孩子藏起来。

en: So when she was a sickly, fretful, ugly little baby she was kept out of the way,
zh: 所以当她还是一个病怏怏，烦躁不安，丑陋的小婴儿的时候，她总是被挡在外面,

en: and when she became a sickly, fretful, toddling thing she was kept out of the way also.
zh: 当她变成一个病态的、烦躁的、蹒跚学步的小东西时，她也被挡在了外面。

en: She never remembered seeing familiarly anything but the dark faces of her Ayah and the other native servants,
zh: 除了她的阿亚和其他当地仆人的黑脸，她再也不记得看到过什么熟悉的东西,

en: and as they always obeyed her and gave her her own way in everything,
zh: 因为他们总是服从她，在任何事情上都给她自己的方式,

en: because the Mem Sahib would be angry if she was disturbed by her crying,
zh: 因为如果她被自己的哭声打扰了，大人会生气的,

en: by the time she was six years old she was as tyrannical and selfish a little pig as ever lived.
zh: 在她六岁的时候，她已经是一个专横而自私的小猪了。

en: The young English governess who came to teach her to read and write disliked her so much that she gave up her place in three months,
zh: 那个来教她读书写字的年轻英国女家庭教师非常不喜欢她，以至于她在三个月内就放弃了她的工作,

en: and when other governesses came to try to fill it they always went away in a shorter time than the first one.
zh: 当其他家庭教师来填补空缺的时候，他们总是比第一个家庭教师离开的时间要短。

en: So if Mary had not chosen to really want to know how to read books she would never have learned her letters at all.
zh: 因此，如果玛丽没有选择真正想知道如何读书，她就根本不会学习她的书信。

en: One frightfully hot morning, when she was about nine years old, she awakened feeling very cross,
zh: 在一个非常炎热的早晨，当她大约九岁的时候，她醒来的时候感到非常生气,

en: and she became crosser still when she saw that the servant who stood by her bedside was not her Ayah.
zh: 当她看到站在她床边的仆人不是她的阿雅时，她更生气了。

en: \"Why did you come?\" she said to the strange woman.
zh: “你为什么来?”她对那个奇怪的女人说。

en: \"I will not let you stay. Send my Ayah to me.\"
zh: “我不会让你留下的，把我的阿亚交给我”

en: The woman looked frightened, but she only stammered that the Ayah could not come
zh: 女人看起来很害怕，但她只是结结巴巴地说阿亚不能来

en: and when Mary threw herself into a passion and beat and kicked her,
zh: 当玛丽陷入激情，不停地打她，踢她的时候,

en: she looked only more frightened and repeated that it was not possible for the Ayah to come to Missie Sahib.
zh: 她看起来更害怕了，她反复说阿亚族人不可能来 Missie Sahib。

en: There was something mysterious in the air that morning.
zh: 那天早上空气中弥漫着神秘的气息。

en: Nothing was done in its regular order and several of the native servants seemed missing,
zh: 没有按照正常的顺序做任何事情，几个当地的仆人似乎失踪了,

en: while those whom Mary saw slunk or hurried about with ashy and scared faces.
zh: 而玛丽看到的那些人则神色灰暗、惊慌失措地偷偷摸摸或匆匆忙忙地走来走去。

en: But no one would tell her anything and her Ayah did not come.
zh: 但是没有人告诉她任何事情，她的阿亚也没有来。

en: She was actually left alone as the morning went on,
zh: 第二天早上，她被单独留在家里,

en: and at last she wandered out into the garden and began to play by herself under a tree near the veranda.
zh: 最后她漫步到花园里，开始独自在阳台附近的一棵树下玩耍。

en: She pretended that she was making a flower-bed, and she stuck big scarlet hibiscus blossoms into little heaps of earth,
zh: 她假装在做一个花坛，把鲜红色的大芙蓉花插在一小堆土里,

en: all the time growing more and more angry and muttering to herself the things she would say and the names she would call Saidie when she returned.
zh: 一直以来，她变得越来越生气，喃喃自语着她要说的话，以及她回来后要叫赛迪的名字。

en: \"Pig! Pig! Daughter of Pigs!\" she said, because to call a native a pig is the worst insult of all.
zh: “猪! 猪! 猪的女儿!”她说，因为把当地人叫做猪是最大的侮辱。

en: She was grinding her teeth and saying this over and over again when she heard her mother come out on the veranda with some one.
zh: 她咬着牙，一遍又一遍地说着这句话，这时她听到她妈妈和一个人从阳台上走了出来。

en: She was with a fair young man and they stood talking together in low strange voices.
zh: 她和一个漂亮的年轻人在一起，他们站在一起用奇怪的低声说话。

en: Mary knew the fair young man who looked like a boy.
zh: 玛丽认识那个长得像男孩的漂亮年轻人。

en: She had heard that he was a very young officer who had just come from England.
zh: 她听说他是一个刚从英国来的年轻军官。

en: The child stared at him, but she stared most at her mother.
zh: 孩子盯着他，但她最多的是盯着她的母亲。

en: She always did this when she had a chance to see her, because the Mem Sahib,
zh: 她每次有机会见到她都会这么做因为大人,

en: Mary used to call her that oftener than anything else,
zh: 玛丽以前经常这么叫她,

en: was such a tall, slim, pretty person and wore such lovely clothes.
zh: 她是那么高，那么苗条，那么漂亮，穿着那么可爱的衣服。

en: Her hair was like curly silk and she had a delicate little nose
zh: 她的头发像卷曲的丝绸，她有一个精致的小鼻子

en: which seemed to be disdaining things, and she had large laughing eyes.
zh: 她有一双大大的笑眯眯的眼睛。

en: All her clothes were thin and floating, and Mary said they were \"full of lace.\"
zh: 她所有的衣服都又薄又漂浮，玛丽说它们“充满了蕾丝”

en: They looked fuller of lace than ever this morning, but her eyes were not laughing at all.
zh: 今天早上，它们看起来比以往任何时候都更有花边了，但是她的眼睛一点也没有笑。

en: They were large and scared and lifted imploringly to the fair boy officer\'s face.
zh: 它们又大又吓人，哀求地举到那个漂亮的男孩军官面前。

en: \"Is it so very bad? Oh, is it?\" Mary heard her say.
zh: “有那么糟糕吗? 哦，是吗?”玛丽听到她说。

en: \"Awfully,\" the young man answered in a trembling voice.
zh: “太可怕了,”年轻人用颤抖的声音回答。

en: \"Awfully, Mrs. Lennox. You ought to have gone to the hills two weeks ago.\"
zh: “太糟糕了，伦诺克斯太太，你两个星期前就该上山去了。”

en: The Mem Sahib wrung her hands.
zh: 议长扭动着她的手。

en: \"Oh, I know I ought!\" she cried. \"I only stayed to go to that silly dinner party. What a fool I was!\"
zh: “哦，我知道我应该！她哭了。我留下来只是为了参加那个愚蠢的晚宴。我真是个傻瓜！\"

en: At that very moment such a loud sound of wailing broke out from the servants\' quarters
zh: 就在这时，仆人们的房间里突然传出一阵如此响亮的哀号声

en: that she clutched the young man\'s arm, and Mary stood shivering from head to foot.
zh: 她紧紧抓住那个年轻人的胳膊，玛丽站在那里，从头到脚都在发抖。

en: The wailing grew wilder and wilder.
zh: 哭声越来越大。

en: \"What is it? What is it?\" Mrs. Lennox gasped.
zh: “怎么了? 怎么了?”伦诺克斯太太倒抽了一口冷气。

en: \"Some one has died,\" answered the boy officer.
zh: “有人死了,”少年军官回答。

en: \"You did not say it had broken out among your servants.\"
zh: “你没有说是在你的仆人中间发生的。”

en: \"I did not know!\" the Mem Sahib cried.
zh: “我不知道!”大人喊道。

en: \"Come with me! Come with me!\" and she turned and ran into the house.
zh: “跟我来! 跟我来!”她转身跑进屋里。

en: After that appalling things happened, and the mysteriousness of the morning was explained to Mary.
zh: 在那之后，可怕的事情发生了，那天早晨的神秘事件被向玛丽解释了。

en: The cholera had broken out in its most fatal form and people were dying like flies.
zh: 霍乱以其最致命的形式爆发了，人们像苍蝇一样死去。

en: The Ayah had been taken ill in the night, and it was because she had just died that the servants had wailed in the huts.
zh: 阿雅在夜里生病了，正是因为她刚刚死去，仆人们才在小屋里哀号。

en: Before the next day three other servants were dead and others had run away in terror.
zh: 第二天以前，又有三个仆人死了，其他人惊恐地逃走了。

en: There was panic on every side, and dying people in all the bungalows.
zh: 到处都是恐慌，所有的平房里都是垂死的人。

en: During the confusion and bewilderment of the second day Mary hid herself in the nursery and was forgotten by every one.
zh: 在第二天的混乱和困惑中，玛丽躲在育儿室里，被每个人都忘记了。

en: Nobody thought of her, nobody wanted her, and strange things happened of which she knew nothing.
zh: 没有人想起她，没有人想要她，奇怪的事情发生了，而她对此一无所知。

en: Mary alternately cried and slept through the hours.
zh: 玛丽时而哭，时而睡。

en: She only knew that people were ill and that she heard mysterious and frightening sounds.
zh: 她只知道人们生病了，她听到了神秘而可怕的声音。

en: Once she crept into the dining-room and found it empty,
zh: 她一溜进餐厅，发现里面空无一人,

en: though a partly finished meal was on the table and chairs and plates looked
zh: 尽管桌子上有一顿吃了一半的饭，椅子和盘子看起来也像

en: as if they had been hastily pushed back when the diners rose suddenly for some reason.
zh: 当食客们因为某种原因突然站起来的时候，他们好像被匆忙地推了回去。

en: The child ate some fruit and biscuits, and being thirsty she drank a glass of wine which stood nearly filled.
zh: 孩子吃了一些水果和饼干，口渴的时候，她喝了一杯几乎满了的葡萄酒。

en: It was sweet, and she did not know how strong it was.
zh: 这是甜的，她不知道它是多么强大。

en: Very soon it made her intensely drowsy, and she went back to her nursery and shut herself in again,
zh: 很快她就昏昏欲睡回到育儿室，再次把自己关在里面,

en: frightened by cries she heard in the huts and by the hurrying sound of feet.
zh: 她被小屋里的哭声和匆忙的脚步声吓坏了。

en: The wine made her so sleepy that she could scarcely keep her eyes open
zh: 酒使她昏昏欲睡，几乎睁不开眼睛

en: and she lay down on her bed and knew nothing more for a long time.
zh: 她躺在床上，很长一段时间什么也不知道。

en: Many things happened during the hours in which she slept so heavily,
zh: 在她睡得那么沉的时候发生了很多事情,

en: but she was not disturbed by the wails and the sound of things being carried in and out of the bungalow.
zh: 但是她没有被哭声和进出平房的东西的声音所打扰。

en: When she awakened she lay and stared at the wall.
zh: 当她醒来时，她躺在那里，盯着墙壁。

en: The house was perfectly still. She had never known it to be so silent before.
zh: 房子里一点动静都没有，她以前从来不知道房子里这么安静。

en: She heard neither voices nor footsteps, and wondered if everybody had got well of the cholera and all the trouble was over.
zh: 她既听不到声音也听不到脚步声，不知道是否每个人都从霍乱中康复了，所有的麻烦都结束了。

en: She wondered also who would take care of her now her Ayah was dead.
zh: 她也想知道现在她的阿亚死了，谁来照顾她。

en: There would be a new Ayah, and perhaps she would know some new stories.
zh: 会有一个新的阿雅，也许她会知道一些新的故事。

en: Mary had been rather tired of the old ones.
zh: 玛丽对那些旧的已经相当厌倦了。

en: She did not cry because her nurse had died.
zh: 她没有哭，因为她的护士死了。

en: She was not an affectionate child and had never cared much for any one.
zh: 她不是一个多情的孩子，从来没有关心过任何人。

en: The noise and hurrying about and wailing over the cholera had frightened her,
zh: 霍乱带来的噪音和匆忙的哀号把她吓坏了,

en: and she had been angry because no one seemed to remember that she was alive.
zh: 她很生气，因为似乎没有人记得她还活着。

en: Every one was too panic-stricken to think of a little girl no one was fond of.
zh: 每个人都惊慌失措，想不起一个没有人喜欢的小女孩。

en: When people had the cholera it seemed that they remembered nothing but themselves.
zh: 当人们患上霍乱时，他们似乎只记得自己。

en: But if every one had got well again, surely some one would remember and come to look for her.
zh: 但是如果每个人都康复了，肯定会有人记得并来找她的。

en: But no one came, and as she lay waiting the house seemed to grow more and more silent.
zh: 但是没有人来，当她躺着等待的时候，屋子里似乎变得越来越安静。

en: She heard something rustling on the matting
zh: 她听到席子上有沙沙声

en: and when she looked down she saw a little snake gliding along and watching her with eyes like jewels.
zh: 当她向下看时，她看见一条小蛇在滑行，用宝石般的眼睛注视着她。

en: She was not frightened, because he was a harmless little thing who would not hurt her
zh: 她并不害怕，因为他是一个不会伤害她的无害的小东西

en: and he seemed in a hurry to get out of the room.
zh: 他看起来急着要离开房间。

en: He slipped under the door as she watched him.
zh: 她注视着他，他从门缝里钻了进去。

en: \"How queer and quiet it is,\" she said.
zh: “多么奇怪和安静啊,”她说。

en: \"It sounds as if there was no one in the bungalow but me and the snake.\"
zh: “听起来好像平房里除了我和蛇就没有别人了。”

en: Almost the next minute she heard footsteps in the compound, and then on the veranda.
zh: 几乎下一分钟，她就听到了院子里的脚步声，然后是走廊上的脚步声。

en: They were men\'s footsteps, and the men entered the bungalow and talked in low voices.
zh: 那是男人的脚步声，男人们走进平房，低声交谈着。

en: No one went to meet or speak to them and they seemed to open doors and look into rooms.
zh: 没有人去见他们，也没有人和他们说话，他们似乎打开门，向房间里张望。

en: \"What desolation!\" she heard one voice say.
zh: “多么荒凉!”她听到一个声音说。

en: \"That pretty, pretty woman! I suppose the child, too.
zh: “那个漂亮，漂亮的女人! 我想那个孩子也是。

en: I heard there was a child, though no one ever saw her.\"
zh: 我听说有个孩子，但没人见过她。”

en: Mary was standing in the middle of the nursery when they opened the door a few minutes later.
zh: 几分钟后他们打开门时，玛丽正站在育儿室的中央。

en: She looked an ugly, cross little thing and was frowning
zh: 她看起来是一个丑陋的、脾气暴躁的小东西，正皱着眉头

en: because she was beginning to be hungry and feel disgracefully neglected.
zh: 因为她开始觉得饿了，觉得自己被忽视了。

en: The first man who came in was a large officer she had once seen talking to her father.
zh: 第一个走进来的是一个大个子军官，她曾经见过他和她父亲说话。

en: He looked tired and troubled, but when he saw her he was so startled that he almost jumped back.
zh: 他看上去疲惫不堪，忧心忡忡，但当他看到她时，他吓了一跳，差点跳了回去。

en: \"Barney!\" he cried out.
zh: “巴尼!”他喊道。

en: \"There is a child here! A child alone! In a place like this! Mercy on us, who is she!\"
zh: “这里有个孩子! 一个孤独的孩子! 在这样的地方! 饶了我们吧，她是谁!”

en: \"I am Mary Lennox,\" the little girl said, drawing herself up stiffly.
zh: “我是玛丽 · 伦诺克斯,”小女孩说着，僵硬地站了起来。

en: She thought the man was very rude to call her father\'s bungalow
zh: 她认为那个男人打电话到她父亲的平房里是非常粗鲁的

en: \"A place like this!\"
zh: “像这样的地方!”

en: \"I fell asleep when every one had the cholera and I have only just wakened up.
zh: “当每个人都得了霍乱时，我睡着了，而我才刚刚醒来。

en: Why does nobody come?\"
zh: 为什么没人来?”

en: \"It is the child no one ever saw!\" exclaimed the man, turning to his companions.
zh: “这是一个从来没有人见过的孩子!”那人喊道，转向他的同伴。

en: \"She has actually been forgotten!\"
zh: “她实际上已经被遗忘了!”

en: \"Why was I forgotten?\" Mary said, stamping her foot.
zh: “为什么我被遗忘了?”玛丽跺着脚说。

en: \"Why does nobody come?\"
zh: “为什么没人来?”

en: The young man whose name was Barney looked at her very sadly.
zh: 那个名叫巴尼的年轻人很伤心地看着她。

en: Mary even thought she saw him wink his eyes as if to wink tears away.
zh: 玛丽甚至认为她看见他眨眼睛，好像是要眨眼把眼泪带走。

en: \"Poor little kid!\" he said.
zh: “可怜的孩子!”他说。

en: \"There is nobody left to come.\"
zh: “没有人会来了”

en: It was in that strange and sudden way that Mary found out that she had neither father nor mother left;
zh: 就在这种奇怪而突然的方式中，玛丽发现她既没有父亲也没有母亲;

en: that they had died and been carried away in the night,
zh: 他们已经死了，在夜里被带走了,

en: and that the few native servants who had not died also had left the house
zh: 还有几个没死的本地仆人也离开了家

en: as quickly as they could get out of it, none of them even remembering that there was a Missie Sahib.
zh: 他们尽可能快地摆脱它，甚至没有人记得有一个 Missie Sahib。

en: That was why the place was so quiet.
zh: 所以这里才这么安静。

en: It was true that there was no one in the bungalow but herself and the little rustling snake.
zh: 的确，平房里除了她自己和那条沙沙作响的小蛇，没有别人。
